title: Setup
text:
Since Positron is under rapid development, we recommend downloading and installing the latest release as close as possible to the date of your workshop.
Get the latest release at: https://positron.posit.co/download.html
Pre-releases are available at: https://github.com/posit-dev/positron/releases

title: Setup
text:
Since Positron is under rapid development, we recommend downloading and installing the latest release as close as possible to the date of your workshop.
Get the latest release at: https://positron.posit.co/download.html
Pre-releases are available at: https://github.com/posit-dev/positron/releases

title: Setup
text:
R - Required
Positron will detect your existing R installation, so if you have a recent version of R (> 4.2) installed, you don’t need to do anything else.
If you don’t have R installed, or need to update, follow the instructions for your operating system at https://cloud.r-project.org/.
You’ll also need the following packages installed:
install.packages(c("tidyverse", "palmerpenguins", "usethis"))

title: Setup
text:
Git - Optional but recommended
Follow the instructions at https://happygitwithr.com/install-git.

title: Exploring Positron
text: Slides

title: Exploring Positron
text:
Bingo Card
Example card
You’ll receive your own unique card in the workshop.






Bingo Solutions: Don’t peek!






Editor

A way to open a new R script file




File > New File… or, 


New > New File… 



Then R File 
Command Palette: R: New R File
Cmd/Ctrl + Shift + N
File Explorer:  New File… button

The shortcut to send R code from the Editor to the Console

Cmd/Ctrl + Enter


The “Find and Replace” dialog box

Edit > Find
Cmd/Ctrl + F
Hit the chevron () to expand for the Replace dialog


The shortcut for the command “Help: Show help at cursor”

F1


Where help, e.g. ?mean, displays

In the Help pane:





Console

The version of R running in the Console

In the Console startup message:

In the Session Selector:

Under Console Info:


The button to restart R running in the Console


Cmd/Ctrl + Shift + 0

The current working directory of R running the Console



Where you can explore variables you’ve defined in the Console

The Variables section of the Session pane





Data Explorer
Run View(mtcars) in the Console, then find:






File Explorer

A prompt to “Open a folder”


File Explorer comes alive once a folder is opened:


An action you can take on a folder once it is open

Buttons: New File…, New Folder
Right-click in Explorer for more options 




Other

An RStudio pane that isn’t in Positron

History
Packages
Build
Tutorial
Background Jobs

The purpose of an icon you’ve never seen before

Hover and you’ll get a tooltip

Room KMC 185 https://www.causeweb.org/cause/uscots/uscots25

Bring your laptop with the latest version of Positron installed. See Setup for detailed instructions.

title: Doing data science in Positron
text:
Instructor
Mine Çetinkaya-Rundel is a Professor of the Practice in the Department of Statistical Science at Duke University and a Developer Educator at Posit PBC.
Hadley Wickham is the Chief Scientist at Posit PBC.

title: Intro to Positron for R/RStudio Users
text:
Before the workshop
Bring your laptop with the latest version of Positron installed. For this workshop in particular, it may be worth it to install a pre-release (instead of the monthly release). See Setup for more.

title: Intro to Positron for R/RStudio Users
text:
Instructor
Jenny Bryan is a senior software engineer at Posit. She’s mostly on loan to the Positron team these days, but she keeps a hand in R package development, as part of the tidyverse team.

title: Intro to Positron for R/RStudio Users
text:
License
This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License.

title: Getting Started with Positron
text:
Positron is a next-generation data science IDE built by Posit PBC that combines the best features of RStudio and Visual Studio Code.
This website hosts materials for a half-day introduction to Positron particularly for R and RStudio users.

title: Getting Started with Positron
text:
Events
This workshop will be offered at several events in 2025:

RaukR with Jenny Bryan, June 2025
Cascadia R Conf with Charlotte Wickham, June 2025
USCOTS with Mine Çetinkaya-Rundel and Hadley Wickham, July 2025
useR with Jenny Bryan and Julia Silge, August 2025

title: Getting Started with Positron
text:

https://github.com/posit-dev/positron-workshop-project
If you don’t have Git installed, you can get the example project via usethis:
usethis::use_course("posit-dev/positron-workshop-project")
